data.name: Ultimaze
data.detailed_description:
Ultimaze is a tile-based puzzle game about navigating small labyrinths.

Move around and interact with objects to reach the goal in 200 single-screen levels that steadily introduce new gameplay features. As the focus is puzzle solving, you can undo your moves at will.

The game isn't based around a single gimmick, but rather features a wide variety of different tiles and game mechanics that mix together to create varied puzzles to solve.

Some of the game mechanics include:

  • Pressing switches to alter tiles
  • Carrying and utilizing items
  • Pushing crates
  • Sliding on ice
  • Traversing lava in various ways
  • Using magnets to push and pull tiles
  • Jumping from springboards

Some of the later levels feature increasingly odd and advanced scenarios:

  • Manipulating a turn timer that alters objects after ticking down to zero
  • Moving around diagonally temporarily
  • Carrying an extended amount of items and duplicating them
  • Destroying yourself by moving into an infinite loop to respawn to a spawnpoint
  • Creating and loading save states of a level to your advantage

Ultimaze also contains a simple level editor tool and a block guide that contains a tutorial levels for each tile type.

data.short_description: Ultimaze is a tile-based puzzle game about navigating small labyrinths.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: 2.0 Ghz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Additional Notes: The game is pretty light and needs Java to run.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Additional Notes: The game is pretty light and needs Java to run.
